noun.description: A nearly simultaneous firing of all the guns from one side of a warship.
A sheet of paper printed on one side only, forming one large page.
examples: a broadside of Lee's farewell address

adverb.description: With the side turned to a particular thing.
examples: the yacht was drifting broadside to the wind

verb.description: Collide with the side of (a vehicle)
examples: I had to skid my bike sideways to avoid broadsiding her
